content.description: Climbs a left facing corner to a finger crack to a ledge before turning into a brief section of fists/wide hands. Pretty good rock.
content.protection: Single set of cam's with perhaps a couple finger sized units. A runner or two might be helpful.
content.location: The route is located around the prow from Split Personality, to the left of a corner.

climbs.name: Stiletto
climbs.fa: Kevin Chase, Lisa Hathaway, Dave Madera Oct. 1995

content.description:
(a.k.a Hueco Route) A short and slabby ultra thin line that splits some very interesting varnished hueco features.

Looks like a crack but climbs like a face.
content.protection: A selection of small to medium stoppers, micro cams and ball nuts
content.location:
Stiletto is located on the furthest south end of the crag, just around the corner of a subtle prow.

The obvious, short, thin thing splitting the hueco'd section of wall

content.description: This fun route starts off in a right facing corner, with a 000's to 00's crack reaches a pod about twenty feet up and continues on as a rattly fingers crack that makes a cool corner change. Past the corner change the crack widens into hands and climbs into some slightly loose rock, arcs right and changes corners again to end in a deep cleft.
content.protection: Doubles up to #2 camalot, blue and purple metolious or equivalent for the start, 3 to 4 .5 and .75 camalots. A runner or two.
content.location: Located at the left side of the wall 100ft or so Left of Dark Path and just before reaching a point where the wall turns a corner and juts in. Anchors are hard to see from below but look for a deep cleft about 100ft up and you'll see them positioned on the left side of the cleft.

content.description: A little bit of Index's lower town wall somehow got misplaced out in Canyonlands. Dark Path is basically an inch-deep chimney that is climbed with more pushing maneuvers than the normal pulling.  Delicate foot/back opposition and balance will get you past a few bolts and a bit of thin crack on A grade Wingate.  This route has some of the best rock in the area.  Clipping the anchor may be difficult...
content.protection: A few tiny and small cams and a few quickdraws.
content.location: The bolted route, two routes to the right of Stiletto at the Scorched Earth Crag. Rappel from two bolt anchor.

content.description: An awkward start through an undercut in the wall gains a splitter crack which goes from fingers, gradually opening up to wide-hands and ends in a flared corner/scoop. stem and face-climb through the flare past a little runout.
content.protection: a Single set of cams from fingers to wide-hands, a tiny unit for protecting the final runout.
content.location: Dante is located on the far right side of the wall, the obvious short splitter.

content.description: Creeker climbs an offset crack through slabby, crispy rock. The bottom of the route is undercut providing an awkward start.
content.protection: Blue Metolius to #2 camalot, stoppers useful.
content.location: The furthermost right route on the wall, just right of Dante.
